intro: Androcalva pedleyi, commonly known as the Pedley's sandalwood, is a rare and unique plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive appearance with small, clustered flowers. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in nutrient-poor soils and extreme drought conditions. Its leaves are typically small and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
